intro: Lepidium chichicara var. pseudobipinnatifidum, commonly known as the Mexican cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the family. It is native to Mexico and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
